intro: Pseva umbellata, commonly known as the common umbel plant, is a flowering plant characterized by its clustered, umbrella-like inflorescence. It typically grows in moist, temperate regions and belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant features slender stems with finely divided leaves and small white or yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties.
